text: Margulis is my favorite, but the Yuriev finale was one of those great moments in the game, up through the battle.Â  It did seem a bit rushed how it ended, however; I wanted Yuriev to acknowledge the Testaments and possibly Wilhelm and wonder wtf was going on.
author: MoonJung82

text: @MoonJung82 The whole 3rd game in that series was basically an attempt to close off a story that had been planned to have at least another 3 or so games. They originally planned out 5 titles (I believe?), and Episode I and II were actually split apart from what was intended to be a single game. That's why the last few hours of Xenosaga Episode III is basically nothing but boss fights with every villain they had introduced up until that point.
author: Azshmo

text: @AzshmoÂ 6 were planned but after II, they had to scrap parts 4, 5 and 6 and cram what they could into 3.
author: LightKnyght

text: @LightKnyght hmm, but I'm not sure whether that's before or after I and II were split apart. Like was it planned as 5 and then I was split into 2 games, making it into 6?
author: Azshmo

text: @Azshmo Actually from what I read, this game was gonna be the last using these characters and then the next one would take place many years in the future
author: Scibren

text: @The42gamer Would it be odd if I said I wished they would continue it later on even though they already "ended" the game? I don't know, there was just something about this game-play, even though III was a bit rushed, that made me excited when I played it. I would definitely play another one if it came out~
author: Yume Hoshiko

text: @Kaida HoshikoÂ That would actually be pretty cool if they did. Takahashi did say around the time that 3 came out that he would be interested in returning to the series in 10 years and it's been about 9 years. Even though Monolith Soft is owned by Nintendo they're on good terms with Namco Bandai, so it's a possibilityÂ
author: Scibren

text: That.... that makes me excited =D
author: Yume Hoshiko

text: @The42gamer Exactly. Xenosaga Ep.IV should have been a retelling of Xenogears set on Earth, featuring the new incarnations of Abel and Nephilim as protagonist. Shion's story ends with III.
author: Helel Bright

text: +lix Axil I would say he was the villain of the story; he (along with Voyager) were the only truly evil individuals in the series, who cared for no one and was looking to gain for his own means, not even his children provoked any feelings from him. Wilhelm was the main antagonist, but his purpose was a good one, to save humanity but because he was immortal, he instigated conflicts to entertain himself.
author: Martin A.

text: +Azshmo They planned 6 games, but after the first didn't perform as well as they expected they had to cut down the series. After the 2nd game flopped, it was all but assured to end with the 3rd game.
author: Martin A.

text: I agree this should have been the final battle...on the Eldritch, right after a fight against Omega Res Novae, in which they liberate Abel from the machine. Then Yuriev unites an embryonic Metempsychosis with the Zohar giving it it's true form,  Deus. Abel then wilfully climbs inside the Res Novae, turning it into an imperfect Xenogears. Deus proceeds to infect Razael central and take over the ship, however Abel, Shion, and KOS MOS are able to wound Deus, forcing it to abandon its immediate plans of boarding the Merkabah. In a financial act of vengeance, it uses Zohar to release U-DO which absorbs Shion into the higher dimension, and kills the others, even chaos. Their fate to be reincarnated on the new planet below due to Zarathustra, Deus bides its time with the intent to activate the song of Nephilim and turn the lambs of the new Jerusalem into gnosis to be consumed as fuel so that it can finally ascend and go on to consume planet after planet. In this way it hopes to gain the power to enter the higher dimension on its own and control all existence. In Xenogears we see the final incarnation of Abel,  Fei finally destroy Deus using the perfect power of Zohar. However, it still leaves the Zarathustra, which I believe KOS MOS and possibly Shion would come back to help destroy in episodes beyond Xenogears. Also I believe Krellian is the incarnation of chaos.

text: One of my favorite RPGs of the last generation. Unlike most games with their "All's Well That Ends Well", this game's story has a nice balance between good and bad/sad moments and that's what makes the story so memorable.
